newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana shares extend post-election gains.
newsitem.headline: Ghana shares extend post-election gains.

text.p: The Ghana Stock Exchange on Monday extended its gains since rebounding after last week's smooth conclusion of presidential and parliamentary elections.

The GSE All-Share Index jumped 1.42 points to close at 359.85. The index climbed 1.2 points last Friday when investors showed renewed interest in the stock market after President Jerry Rawlings won a final four-year term of office.

Although total volume of shares traded fell to 218,800 shares from 841,360 in the previous session, it was markedly higher than turnover in the weeks before the December 7 elections. Volume then ranged between 18,000 and 60,000 shares.
Analysts blamed the lacklustre sessions then to uncertainty ahead of the polls.
In Monday's trading, offers went up to 2,276,700 shares compared with total bids of 1,356,400 shares.
